doc.title: Bank of Ningbo (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Accelerated earnings growth amid stabilizing asset quality BuyAccelerated earnings growth amid stabilizing asset quality_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 33.04 CNY | Price: 28.29 CNY

PPOP and net profit accelerated, interim div announcedBONB's 1H25 pre-provision profit (PPOP) rose 11.8% YoY (vs 10.0% in 1Q), 1H net profit rose 8.2% YoY (vs +5.8% in 1Q). ROE declined 0.9ppt YoY to 13.8% in 1H. CET1 ratio edged up 4bp YoY to 9.65%. BONB first time declared an interim dividend with DPS of RMB0.3 and payout ratio of 13.4%, the management guides that the full year dividend payout is likely to be no less than that of FY24. We keep our estimates unchanged, reiterate Buy for given its accelerated revenue/PPOP/earnings growth, improved asset quality and attractive P/B valuation.

Modest NIM dip, better non- interest income, lower CIRNet interest income rose 0.4% QoQ, with interest income/expense up 0.7%/0.9% QoQ. NIM fell 6bp QoQ to 1.74% in 2Q, or 12bp YoY to 1.76% in 1H. Loan growth remained fast at 2.0% QoQ/13.4% HoH/18.7% YoY, with corporate loans/retail loans/bills +26%/- 4%/+7% HoH, making up 108%/- 11%/- 4% of new loans in 1H. Faster loan growth seen in leasing & commercial service sector and slower growth seen in retail given NPL pressure. Assets/deposits rose 2.2%/- 4.9% QoQ or 14.4%/12.7% YoY. Demand deposit mix rose 5ppt/4ppt HoH/YoY to 35.2%. LDR up 4ppt YoY to 80.6%. Net fee income rose 4% YoY in 1H (vs - 1.3% in 1Q) driven by agency fees, which was up by 10% YoY. Other non- interest income up 0.6% YoY in 1H, vs. - 6.5% in 1Q. Revenue/operating cost grew 8.0%/0.4% YoY in 1H (vs +5.8%/- 2.7% YoY in 1Q), and cost- income ratio (CIR) fell 2.4ppt YoY to 31.5% in 1H. Effective tax rate - 4.4ppt from 12.0% in 1H24 to 7.6% in 1H25.

Gross NPL formation slowed down, coverage built upNPL ratio was flat QoQ at 0.76% and SML ratio also remained largely stable at 1.02%. Gross NPL formation fell from 100bp/97bp in 1H24/FY24 to 81bp in 1H25, early signs of asset quality stabilization. Write- off also declined from 82bp/84bp in 1H24/FY24 to 63bp in 1H25. Retail loan NPL ratio increased 18bp HoH to 1.86%, of which, personal consumption/operating/mortgage loans' NPL ratios were 1.83%/3.30%/0.71% by 1H25, up from 1.61%/2.97%/0.63% by 2H24. Credit cost rose 8bp YoY to 109bp in 1H25. NPL and loan reserve coverage ratios rose 3.6ppt/2bp QoQ to 374.2% and 2.84% respectively, the first time QoQ increase since 2022.

BONB is a top 5 city commercial bank in China by total assets/loans/deposits. It mainly operates in Zhejiang and Jiangsu Province. It has a differentiated positioning in the SME and non-mortgage retail businesses, and adopts a unique client acquisition model of list-based + door-to-door + online. It has a diversified shareholding structure, with SASAC of Ningbo Municipal Government, Singapore OCBC Bank and Younger Group having the most shareholdings.

We rate BONB as Buy as we expect the re-emphasizing of private sector led by President Xi to be positive for market- oriented banks such as BONB, which mainly serve mid- sized enterprises/private companies. BONB also sees strong loan demand and receives higher loan quota, which will be directly granted by the PBOC head office starting in 2025. Its asset quality pressure is also likely to be relieved after large write-offs in FY24 on retail loans.

Our PO of CNY33.04 is based on 0.89x 2025- 26E P/B, which is derived from an adjusted Gordon Growth model that assumes an average ROE of \(13.8\%\) , a medium- term growth rate of \(4.0\%\) , and a cost of equity of \(15.0\%\) . At our PO, the stock would be trading at 7.0x 2025- 26E P/E or 4.3x 2025- 26E P/PPOP.
Downside risks to our earnings forecasts and PO are significant asset quality downturn in its SME and retail consumer lending, lower- than- expected volume growth, and sharp margin compression.
Upside risks are better- than- expected margin trend, and lower- than- expected credit costs.
